text: The Elephanta Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a collection of cave temples predominantly dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.Elephanta Island, Encyclopedia Britannica They are on Elephanta Island, or Gharapuri (literally "the city of caves"). Parts of the film was portrayed as in depicting in the The Golden Voyage of Sinbad. ==References== Category:National symbols of India Category:World Heritage Sites in India
title: Elephanta Caves
